Class ScriptRunnable

java.lang.Object
scriptsetter.ScriptRunnable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ScriptRunnable extends Object implements Runnable
A Runnable that executes a single script workload run.

This class is responsible for running a Script on a specific workload file. When executed it:

  1. loads workload and processor data via DataReader,
  2. configures a Simulator (simulation time, scheduling/partition algorithm, concurrency-control protocol and DVFS method),
  3. starts the simulation, collects per-core power samples and other metrics, builds a ScriptResult, and attaches it to the originating Script.

The class uses reflection to instantiate algorithm implementations by name (factory-style methods at the bottom of the class). Exceptions thrown by those reflection calls are propagated by the factory methods so callers can handle them appropriately.

Author:
YC

  • Field Details

    • parent

      public ScriptSetter parent
      Parent UI/controller that created this runnable. Public to match the project's existing usage where external code may access the parent field directly (e.g. for error dialogs or higher-level coordination).

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the simulation for the configured Script and workload file.

      This method performs the following actions in sequence:

      • Loads workload and processor definitions from XML files using DataReader (workload path is formed from the script's workload site and the provided workload filename).
      • Configures the Simulator with simulation time (scaled by magnificationFactor), scheduling algorithm, partition algorithm, concurrency control protocol and DVFS method obtained from the Script configuration.
      • Starts the simulator and, when finished, gathers power samples and other metrics into a new ScriptResult which is then added to the parent Script.

      All runtime exceptions are caught; on error a dialog is shown to the user and the exception is logged. The method does not propagate checked exceptions because it handles them internally.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts this runnable in a new thread if it is not already running.

      This method creates a new Thread to execute run() and starts it. Subsequent calls while the thread is already running have no effect.

    • getPartitionAlgorithm

      public PartitionAlgorithm getPartitionAlgorithm(String name) throws ClassNotFoundException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException, IllegalArgumentException, InvocationTargetException
      Creates a PartitionAlgorithm instance by class name using reflection.
      Parameters:
      name - simple class name (the implementation is expected under package "PartitionAlgorithm.implementation")
      Returns:
      a new PartitionAlgorithm instance
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - if the implementation class cannot be found
      InstantiationException - if the class cannot be instantiated
      IllegalAccessException - if the no-arg constructor is not accessible
      NoSuchMethodException - if the expected constructor cannot be found
      IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid argument is passed to the reflective constructor invocation
      InvocationTargetException - if the constructor throws an exception

    • getPrioritySchedulingAlgorithm

      public PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm getPrioritySchedulingAlgorithm(String name) throws ClassNotFoundException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      Creates a PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm instance by class name using reflection. The implementation is expected under "schedulingAlgorithm.implementation".
      Parameters:
      name - simple class name of the scheduling algorithm implementation
      Returns:
      a new PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm instance
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - if the implementation class cannot be found
      InstantiationException - if the class cannot be instantiated
      IllegalAccessException - if the no-arg constructor is not accessible
